intro: Leucocraspedum utahense, commonly known as Utah leucocrinum, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Utah. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It has a short lifespan and is often found in open, sun-exposed areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
